title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, for visualizing and interacting with robotic systems. It offers real-time data monitoring, control functionalities, and diagnostic tools, making it a versatile project focused on enhancing the accessibility and usability of robot fleets.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: crud-expense-tracker is a simple web application built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, utilizing Material-UI for a clean and intuitive interface. This project implements full CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) functionality for tracking expenses, allowing users to easily manage their financial records. It serves as a practical example of basic web development principles and provides a starting point for learning about front-end development with Material-UI.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a personal project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to create a customizable developer dashboard. This project leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, offering a modern and organized platform for tracking projects, tasks, and other relevant developer information. It serves as a practical demonstration of combining these technologies into a functional and visually appealing application.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [mention the project's core purpose or functionality based on your understanding. If the README describes a specific type of application like a task manager, say that. Otherwise, keep it generic]. It leverages modern web development practices and aims to [mention a key benefit or goal of the project, e.g., provide a streamlined user experience, demonstrate a specific technical approach].

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, aimed at providing a functional and visually appealing dashboard interface. This repository serves as a practical example for building modern web applications with Next.js, showcasing best practices in component structure, data fetching, and styling. It offers a foundation for developers looking to create robust and scalable dashboards.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using TeX for generating a professional-looking PDF and a simplified HTML version for online viewing and parsing. This project showcases my skills in document generation, web development, and serves as a readily available example of my qualifications and experience.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, and CSS. This project serves as a practical demonstration of building a web application with a relational database backend, focusing on implementing core CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) functionalities. It explores key concepts in web development and database interaction, making it a valuable resource for learning and understanding these technologies.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project focused on creating interactive and informative map visualizations using HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing and backend logic (if applicable). This repository explores techniques for displaying geographical data and insights in a user-friendly manner, covering various aspects of map rendering and data integration for effective project visualization.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a collaborative project idea management platform built using Next.js, TypeScript, and CSS, providing a space for users to brainstorm, organize, and develop innovative concepts. This repository showcases a modern web application leveraging TypeScript's type safety alongside clean CSS styling to create a user-friendly experience for project planning and collaborative idea generation.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt over time. This application tracks sleep patterns and calculates the difference between ideal and actual sleep hours, providing insights into sleep habits and promoting better sleep hygiene. This project showcases TypeScript implementation for building interactive web applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository implements an IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, leveraging Supabase for backend services. It provides a user interface to monitor and manage the location of assets, utilizing real-time data and focusing on a clean, modern design. This project demonstrates a full-stack approach to IoT solutions, showcasing integration with database services and front-end frameworks.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project that allows users to create and manage a dynamic, interactive event calendar. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository provides a foundation for displaying and organizing events with customizable features, offering a flexible solution for scheduling and event management applications.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, explores various financial concepts and tools through practical projects. It serves as a learning resource for applying Python to analyze financial data, develop trading strategies, and perform portfolio optimization.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js, leveraging the Gemini API to provide intelligent and engaging conversational experiences. This project explores the integration of AI-powered language models into a modern web interface, demonstrating best practices in TypeScript development, API integration, and responsive design using CSS and JavaScript, showcasing a practical application of cutting-edge technologies within the Gemini AI ecosystem.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a modern, decentralized voting platform built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, enabling secure and transparent online elections. This project explores the implementation of voting mechanisms with a focus on user experience and accessibility, offering a practical example of using current web technologies to create a functional and engaging voting application.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: Ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, helping developers debug and understand their robotic systems. This project focuses on offering a comprehensive solution for log analysis within the ROS ecosystem.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a dynamic web project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on [mention the project's specific purpose from the README, e.g., creating an interactive world map or visualizing global data]. This repository showcases [mention key features or goals, e.g., modern front-end development practices and interactive user experiences] related to the 'project' topic.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a comprehensive e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and React. It leverages MUI for a rich UI experience and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. This repository showcases a full-fledged online store implementation, focusing on best practices for type safety and modern web development workflows, providing a valuable learning resource for developers interested in e-commerce solutions and Next.js development.
